en: A pronouncement   concerning Tyre:  # 23:1 Jos 19:29; 1Kg 5:1; Jr 25:22; 47:4; Ezk 26:1–27:36; Jl 3:4–8; Am 1:9; Zch 9:2–4

ngiemboon: Pi pie pi tsẅé menkwɔʼɔ́ ntse,
Eshúm sie mé lɔ́ɔn ḿbye mengʉ̀ŋe ntse Nílè,

en: Be ashamed, Sidon, the stronghold of the sea,

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Egíbtò ge láʼ júʼ wɔɔn nkʉ̀,
Pi pʉ̀a Tîi, pi túm ntse máŋʉ́,
Tà yɔɔn áa tÿǒsoŋo gí gie á laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ,
Epʉ̀a tÿǒsoŋo Tîi zɔ̌ lɔ́ɔn ńnéŋe mefùɔ na lʉŋ.
Aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ,
en: The Lord of Armies planned it,

ngiemboon: Gù tÿǒsoŋo Tîi, jʉ́ʼʉ tsetsáʼ jú
en: Overflow   your land like the Nile, daughter of Tarshish;
He stretched out his hand over the sea;
Look at the land of the Chaldeans —

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, mé ge pú lege tÿǒsoŋo Tîi, tà e gÿo ngùʼ móm sɔɔnmbʉ́a. E lɔg ńgwɔ́ nzẅìŋ ngùʼ gẅie tàʼ fùɔ lɔg ńtsẅé. Ngùʼ móm sɔɔnmbʉ́a ŋwɛ́ ge láʼ gwaa cʉ́me, ammó gie á la gÿo káatÿǒ manzwě gẅie aa tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn zɔ̀bɔ ntse, á gÿo tÿǒsoŋo Tîi:
en: On that day Tyre will be forgotten for seventy years #— #the life span of one king. At the end of seventy years, what the song says about the prostitute will happen to Tyre:

ngiemboon: Gù káatÿǒ manzwě gẅie nyìŋ te gú pá,
Mɛ̌ mengùʼ móm sɔɔnmbʉ́a ge láʼ cʉ́me, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gÿo mmó tÿǒsoŋo Tîi. Epʉ̀a mengwòŋ ntsèm pâ pʉ̀a tÿǒsoŋo Tîi táŋa metʉ̌a, epʉ̀a Tîi gíŋe ńzye léjÿó pì.
en: And at the end of the seventy years,   the Lord will restore Tyre  # 23:17 Ac 21:7 and she will go back into business, prostituting herself with all the kingdoms of the world throughout the earth.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, apì gie pɔ́ ge jÿó, lâ pèen fàʼa yɔ́b ge láʼ cʉ́ʼ gwɔ́ pɔ́ ye Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Ngwɔ́ pɔ́ le láʼ ńcúʼte sɔɔn shúm wɔ́, é ké le leʼe. Mé ge láʼa lɔgɔ pìi fàʼa yɔ́b, é jÿɔ́gɔ pʉ̀a pie é faʼa fàʼa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tà pɔ́ zẅɛ́ɛ. É piŋe lɔgɔ náa menzsǒ mie é sí né pɔ́b.
en: But her profits and wages will be dedicated to the Lord. They will not be stored or saved, for her profit will go to those who live in the Lord’s presence, to provide them with ample food and sacred clothing.
